insert into sys_role (role_name, role_key, descripation, order_num, `status`, create_user, create_date, update_user, update_date, remark) values (#{roleName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{roleKey,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{descripation,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{orderNum,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{status,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{createUser,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{createDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{updateUser,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{updateDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{remark,jdbcType=VARCHAR})
mapper.update: update sys_role set role_name = #{roleName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, role_key = #{roleKey,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, descripation = #{descripation,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, order_num = #{orderNum,jdbcType=INTEGER}, `status` = #{status,jdbcType=INTEGER}, create_user = #{createUser,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, create_date = #{createDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, update_user = #{updateUser,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, update_date = #{updateDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, remark = #{remark,jdbcType=VARCHAR} where role_id = #{roleId,jdbcType=INTEGER}
mapper.select: select role_id, role_name, role_key, descripation, order_num, `status`, create_user, create_date, update_user, update_date, remark from sys_role where role_id = #{roleId,jdbcType=INTEGER}
